Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to infer which events belong to same patient case based on shared attributes: patient_age, gender, department progression, maybe following order. Look at events: Event 1: Register patient, dept ER, patient age 45 M. Event 4: Initial triage age 45 M, dept ER. Event 7: X-ray imaging age 45 M, dept Radiology. Event 15: Patient discharged age 45 M, dept ER.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So these likely belong to a case starting at event 1 (Register patient) for a 45-year-old male with ER registration, then triage, then X-ray, then discharge. But there is also event 6 Doctor consultation Surgery at 08:13:00 for age 28 M. Thats separate.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 2: Register patient age 62 F dept ER. Then event5 triage age 62 F dept ER. Event8 Lab test requested age 62 F dept ER. Event11 Doctor consultation age 62 F dept ER. Event14 Prescription created age 62 F dept ER. Event17 discharge age 62 F dept ER. So that seems a second case (female 62).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event3 Register patient age 28 M dept Surgery (maybe direct to Surgery). Then event6 Doctor consultation Surgery age 28 M. Event9 Surgery preparation age 28 M Surgery. Event13 Surgery performed age 28 M Surgery. Event16 Recovery room Surgery age 28 M Surgery. Then discharge at 08:30? Actually discharge event15 is age 45 M in ER. Event17 discharge age 62 F ER. Event18 discharge age 28 M Surgery. So each case ends with discharge.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Thus we have three distinct patient journeys: Case A: Age 45 Male: events 1,4,7,15? Also maybe other events with same age/gender? Check any other events with age 45 M: none else. So case includes events 1 (Register ER), 4 (Initial triage ER), 7 (X-ray Radiology), 15 (Patient discharged ER).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case B: Age 62 Female: events 2 (Register ER),5 (Initial triage ER),8 (Lab test requested ER),11 (Doctor consultation ER),14 (Prescription created ER),17 (Patient discharged ER). Case C: Age 28 Male: events 3 (Register patient Surgery),6 (Doctor consultation Surgery),9 (Surgery preparation Surgery),13 (Surgery performed Surgery),16 (Recovery room Surgery),18 (Patient discharged Surgery).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus we can infer case IDs based on patient_age and gender and department progression.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Thus answer: three cases: Case 1 (45M): events 1,4,7,15. Case 2 (62F): events 2,5,8,11,14,17. Case 3 (28M): events 3,6,9,13,16,18.
